content: The game is just like the board game. The graphics are ok, but nothing flashy. However, the AI keeps refusing to take their turn. It's happened 3 games in a row and there's no way to finish the game. I would play with human opponents, but there doesn't seem to be a way of I'm playing with a friend.
There is some bug in the tutorial :/

I don't normally leave 1 star reviews, but I did pay $10 for this, so it needs to be seen. I'm brand new to the game, but I think I understand the rules enough. There's a bug with terraforming; I have the option to choose it as an action, and then I choose the land that's highlighted and when I do, I'm not able to choose the land on the spades screen. All the lands or some of them are not selectable. Please fix this and other game breaking bugs people have mentioned. In 2 Easy AI opponent game.

Very frustrating. The app often wants to trash my power (purple cubes) even when I have the resources to take an action. The AI gets insanely high scores and it's difficult to follow how they are doing it as there's no explanation of points being awarded. It seems like the AIs never run out of resources. Between being robbed of power and the lowest level AIs earning 20-25 points per turn it's hard to escape last place. The tabletop game isn't 1/4 as difficult.
Great job. Its does cut out but it might be my phone.
Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is impressive that the AIs can actually play such a complicated game! I want to know if or when the merchants of the seas expansion is coming out. CAN'T WAIT!!!!!!!

The overall experience is great against AI. It loses 2 stars for the following: 1. When given the option to take purple mastery in exchange for VP, you cannot view the board. My decision might be affected if there is an action still available to turn in for the mastery. 2. When playing online, I run out of time while waiting for an opponent. Why is my time affected by an opponent? I have "played" 5 online games, but never even gotten past set up because time runs out on someone elses turn.

This is the worst tutorial I've ever used. The 'intro' section just threw a bunch of characters spewing incomprehensible lore at me, and then asked me to press a button I hadn't been shown yet, in a cluttered interface I know nothing about. Skipped to the next tutorial "basic controls' and it referred to things that are not visible onscreen, and then another instruction to press a button I can't find. Spent $10, Tried two tutes, couldn't complete the first instruction of either. Pathetic.

The board game is amazing and the app does work. The UI/UX is very poor though. A good example of why the interface segregation principal exists. Every single button and text field in the whole game is 10 pixels tall on one screen. Makes it tedious to control and view info. Would strongly prefer to have separate windows to view income, the resources of other players, ect
Decent implementation.
Excellent
One of the best digital board game, the new ai is also crazy smart

Changed my review, now everything is fixed it works a treat! Everything is pretty well layed out, and so far it's been bug free. My only criticism is that the Easy bots are still reeeally hard to beat. Maybe I'm just not very good at this game? Not played it online yet, but I've never really been interested in online gaming
replyContent: Hey there, we already have a hotfix in the pipeline. It only crashes if you bought the game newly or logged out of the profile after updating. The fix is already in the validation queue since a week. There has been changes in the validation process on playstore. Please wait for the update 62

content: The game itself is amazing, however the app can be annoyingly buggy. Restart moves button not always available (then need to restart app). Chat unavailable on some of my devices. App very slow to load on startup. If such bugs were fixed, my 3 star would easily be a 5. Thanks for creating a great game.
The program is broken ! Digidiced obv don't give a damn about keeping games working once they have your money.....multiple bugs now. Bet I can't refund !
The most perfect boardgame port! I love every single game these developers create!!

9th July update has broken notifications, making the game kinda unplayable vs other people. Been playing TM on this app for years now, and I love the game, but the frequency of bugs, slow turn around on bug fixes, and general slowness of the app is incredibly frustrating.
replyContent: Hello there, we are on it. The hotfix is in the pipeline since a week... we are waiting for the validation any day. This login problem only happens if you log out or newly bouoght the game.

content: Ever since the most recent update I no longer receive notifications when it is my turn. Any reason for this?
replyContent: Hello there, we are on it. The hotfix is in the pipeline since a week... we are waiting for the validation any day. This login problem only happens if you log out or newly bought the game.

content: Very nice implementation of the boardgame

The game is so close to being good but falls short due to the number and frequency of bugs. The worst by far is the text glitches and becomes unreadable halfway through EVERY game. I only play against the AI and I'm still waiting for a game without bugs.
Crashes in the tutorial on my Pixel C. Unplayable.
I love this game but it has some game breaking bugs

5/5 because: It can become turn-based; you have several hours to make a move. You can play with friends and/or with AI. Everything is explained with the tutorials, if you have played TM at least once, you will get used to the interfaces really fast. No bug (I've been playing with 2 friends and with AI for a month now). No ad. You can cancel your action before confirming your turn. You can see the next income you will get at the next round. There is a scoreboard that you can check anytime.

They did a nice job on the look and feel and i like the design and everything. Good setup forTerra mystica as a game and decent overview. But it gets one star due to the following critical issues at this high price point which i find unacceptable: * The ai bots stalls at times and doesnt move. i had to cancel a several hour game yesterday due to this at a point were it was quite exciting. * Similar to other reviews i experienced continued glitches in economy scoring and cult track view making the economic parts unreadable. Doesnt change on my device on in and out check. So lost a game here. the above made me loose several of the games midway or towards the end. Almost half. At this time i dont feel like using it at all. Secondly, but more acceptable. the ai needs more levels but initially its a nice ai experience. I reqret purchasing this game. A big shame cause it has so much good in it.
Couldn't place priest due to a bug

I love Terra Mystica. But the app itself crashes too much. The resources indicator sometimes have glitches, wrong bonus tile display at income phases, and an AI that takes FOREVER to take a turn ( yes forever and makes me quit at the midgame because he doesn't even move while the loading indicator is still spinning for a long long time)
Is there any ways to turn off the mini expansions? the main reason i bought the game is to practice TM but with the presence of mini expansions it change a lot of the gameplay

Generally a good app for a great board game. There are some bugs, like UI in the wrong sorting layer, AI which hangs until force restarting the app, wrong bonus scrolls showing for players and resources appearing to go to the wrong player (although I think this is just a UI bug). The UI might seem overwhelming at first but that's because this is a complex game, not because it's poorly laid out. They did a good job with the layouts and the AI difficulty.

Game is good. The only big I found is that the display around resource totals get weird after a while. I noticed it playing locally against AI after I have the app open for a while. I just close the app, reopen, and the game autosaves so I pick up where I left off. AI is good. UI is good for being such a dense game.

Great app, but the online games are super slow and the bots could be smarter. At first it was difficult to get used to the crowded UI on the phone, but I think it's really well designed once you get the hang of it.

I'm a lifelong board game fan. But this game, which is reportedly one of the best board games ever made, just left me bored. For me it was just not fun. The app itself worked very well. So if you think you'll enjoy the game itself, the app does work well and it does support asynchronous play.
Love this game. Hundreds of hours of fun.
Lots of bugs with Mermaids, and difficult to play. Couldn't found towns for some reason. I got a refund.
Love this game and great ui!

Would get 5 stars except for a few problems: 1. Game will freeze in the middle 2. Unable to save a game. If I have to stop mid game it will cancel the game 3. The graphics will screw up and wont be able to see my resources or opponents resources. 4. When asked to use free shovel, if you say yes but actually have no way to use it you get put in limbo and cant move forward or back. That's all I can think of. Rest of the game is amazing.
Tutorial is trash
The game is great, but the app leaves something to be desired. If I lose connection for a second, it makes me restart the app completely, which is a tedious process.
Great game. good AI. lots of replayability.

Must be due for an update ? very buggy lately.... Love the game..... Will the expansions be added ? eg) chaos portal cave of wisdom etc......and the new.shipping expansion that will be launched this year?
Too many unnecessary animations. A.I. difficulty also forces them to take longer turns for some reason.

Functional game, but I do not understand how it works. There are built in tutorials for the rules, but I just don't understand the games economy. There is clearly an optimal move every turn but not only do I not see what it is, I have no idea how to determine what it could even be. THis would probably be best if you already know how to play the tabletop version, but starting from scratch will leave you frustrated and confused.
great but a bit buggy.
coupon didn't apply and means of help to correct the issue
Excellent port. The graphics are delightful and the faction specific music is well done.
Love it
fun works well

Bought the game, would not allow me to play because it was having an error trying to sign in to my Google Play account. Uninstalled immediately and refunded. If I pay for a game, it should not require me to be signed in to be able to play it.
The app works well enough, but it's a lot of information for a phone game. It's probably a serviceable version of the board game, but it's not that fun.
Faithful recreation of a fantastic board game. It's remarkable they were able to condense it down to fit on a phone.
good!

Solo play has decent AI, but casual multiplayer doesn't. Why? Multiplayer AI always picks starting actions (starting with player 5 correctly) from left to right (player 5 picks action 1, player 4 action 2, etc); the AI aren't shuffled with the human players (I play 5 player, but with 2 humans and 3 AI, and us 2 humans are always players 1 and 2); the AI always place initial dwellings in the same place no matter where opponents have settled; and more. When I do single player the AI is fine tho.

Bug: When playing Yeti's and you gain the tile that allows you to found a town with 6 power, the game will not recognise this when you try with a sanctuary (4 power for Yeti's) and a trading post (2 power). Other than that, the game is great, just hoping support is active still to fix bugs.
Chat function doesn't seem to work for me. Also the connection to game network takes a tad longer than I'd like. Otherwise a great game
Excellent app. Beating the middle AIs is a challenge. I only wish there was a way too skip the animations as they get tiring after a while.

Based on the the board game of the same name it's definitely very fun. The biggest problem though is the network! So hard to play games sometimes because there's always network issues. You would think in a turn based game, the network connectivity would be the least problematic thing. Sometimes I can't view my games. while trying to take my turn I get thrown out of the game. I constantly have to exit the game and end the application in order to unfreeze the game. If you won't mind those issues(which are made up for by the game play) , then the game is great.
I love it. Can't wait for Gaia Project. Hurry up.
When I bought the game Fire and Ice was included, but now it's asking me to pay for it. This is a total rip off.

Faithful reproduction of the board game. Some minor UI issues and the interface takes some practice, but as a long-time fan of the board game this is a real joy to play overall. Highly recommended to any TM fan.
Bug that causes ai to freeze when exchanging resources. Otherwise an easy 5 stars.
replyContent: Hi David, we will look into it. Is this happening regularly? Online or offline play?

content: Playing locally, the ai seems to crash often. I think it's when they convert resources like priest to worker. And I swear it seems to always be the engineers. They just converted a priest to a worker in rnd 4 and just sits there now. Sometimes I can kill the game, come back in and it'll move on and be good but not always

Until they finally put in decent online multiplayer modes this game will continue to be money I wish I'd never spent. Response: please go play Through the Ages or Lords of Waterdeep if you need an example. Also it is ridiculous you cannot be in the fast game queue unless the game is on screen. Let me minimize while I wait and send me a notification. Also your fast game is 6 minutes, hardly what I would call fast. Maybe you should have someone respond too these that actually knows the game?
replyContent: Hi Robert, what is a decent multiplayer mode in your opinion? Terra Mystica offers a slow (72 hrs) ranked game mode, a casual mode (without time limit) and a ranked fast game mode where you are practically playing live (with a 3 minute timer). Please let us know what you are missing and how we can help you. Cheers

content:
Did i really pay $10 for an app to show ads every few minutes? I can 
understand ads on free apps, but not for paid apos and expecially not for 
expensive apps.
replyContent: Hi Chris, we are at a loss here? Why are there ads coming? Make sure your phone is not hacked, as Terra Mystica is a premium app and does not feature any ads!

content:
Please tell me the name of the opening music and amke it so I can download 
it for my ringtone...

The basic game is no longer exclusively payable unless you have a group of 
friends to play with.
Great adaption to mobile. One of my favorite boardgames to play on my phone.

The update was supposed to bring a better AI but it seems it has gotten 
worse if anything. Overall, still a good game, but disappointing how long 
of a wait for very little improvement.

Until Gaia Project becomes an app, TM, while still needing further improvements, be the best for now.  I had a single player game where I played the Riverwalkers, built a town, got a priest bonus with the points but not the priest. (I had plenty reserved from unlocking terrains.) It was ultimately needed for me to win a game.

This is a very faithful version of the board game, which despite it's large board and numerous tracks stills plays really well on a small Smartphone.  If you like the game it's hard to go wrong here. Graphics and animations are excellent, but there are a lot of cumbersome sub menus and turn lengths are longer then they ought due to long accounting animations that take place when you spend or score points or money.  I didn't try the multiplayer but the AI is fun. Don't be fooled by the "Easy" AI, they can put up a good fight.

Love Terra Mystica. Waiting for better AIs. Not a fan of having the differentiation of the AIs as how long you have to wait for every turn. Who really wants to wait 5-20 seconds unnecessarily for an AI?
Awesome app, easy to add friends and play with them. I wish the time limit was longer per turn but at least it doesn't kick you out automatically.

The game does an okay job at emulating the board game, but the UI is very small and  unintuitive at times. Also, there are a lot of bugs related to online multiplayer game loading. Multiple matches were corrupted or I dropped out involuntarily. Seems like a shaky server-side implementation.

Used to work well.  The AI is rather bad at the game, so as a single player game it is a way to practice, but not to be challenged. It used to be a good  multiplayer experience. Though the player base is flaky. Many players quit before the game ends and you and up playing against bots. But more recently...the app is incapable of syncing with Google play. So multiplayer is unusable.
Love the game, but the 72 hour move timer in online games is far too generous. I am only making one move per week. I have to have 5 games going just to make one move a day.
Can't play online. It told me to restart the app, update Google play and clear cache. I did all of that and still got an error.
AI is utter garbage. Blatant scam. Only easy AI is available with medium and hard 'coming soon' forever. Consider this multiplayer only.
Good, but can't use the alchemists ability to get points for gold in the head to head games. Can turn gold in but get no points.

The app occasionally gets stuck, but simply reloading the game fixes these problems.  The gameplay is great and the easy scoring tracker makes end game strategy easy.  Recommended for those that love the board game.  Not an easy game for those new to the German genre style games.  Game time is long.  Both comments about Terra Mystica.  The app is a great conversation.

I LOVE Terra Mystica, but this version is almost unplayable. It's really clunky. Critical information is buried in secondary screens. This is the worst implementation of a tabletop game I've ever played.
Need to add a random option to choose faction.  Also, there is no notification when receiving message from other players.

Really disappointed with the game. I've just bought the board game for Christmas and was looking for the app to practice on. The buttons are too small for phone use, the games don't save mid way through and the AI's are slow. If I'd paid a couple of pounds for this fair enough but 8 quid is a lot for a game that won't save!!
One big problem is.. The game should ask about canceling running game

Overall the game is solid, but right now it won't let me login in and I cannot even play a simple game with my wife on her phone sitting across from me. Help! I have restarted my phone and reinstalled the game, still the same problem.

The game itself is great. So much strategy to wrap your head around but it is a much more enjoyable experience overall. I am having trouble using the online part, though. It keeps coming up with a googleauthtoken error or something.
I cannot play this on my Pixel. I cant place priests on the cult track. Completely broken bc of this, so dont buy if you have a Google Pixel
replyContent: Hi Gregory, could you please send a bug report to support@digidiced.com with a detailed error description and screenshots? Thank you very much for your help and sorry for any inconvenience.

content: Unplayable on my phone, the UI for placing priests on the cult track doesn't work so it is impossible to add a priest to the track. This makes it impossible to even play through that section of the tutorial.

Can't even get through the tutorial. First and second tutorial get to the point where you can't go any further. It says to close something to continue but the only thing you can select is end tutorial.

Update: I was wrong! You can add AI to online games. Do buy this game and support the developers.  Great implementation except that you can't add AI to casual games. I want to play with my friend online, but we find 2-player games boring. Why can't we add AIs? It's available in local games, so should be incredibly easy to implement. Very disappointing, and means I will rarely play. Add this functionality and I'll change this to a 5 star review.

So far it's been great... But it won't let me select either of my priest actions (add permanently or return to bank) associated with the cult track. So, I'm at an impasse in my first game, on the second turn.

I'm sure the actual gameplay is alright, however the tutorial experience is a mess, finnicky touch controls had me skip multiple dialog boxes, the game only sometimes properly indicates what it is referring to, got to the town tiles screen where it suggests reading the choices and picking one, but i didn't see any text come up describing the choices at all.  Disappointing, especially after the exception tutorial in Through the Ages.  That's the last time I hold off on trying a game after purchasing it, if I wasn't out if the refund period I would be refunding it.

If you like the board game, you'll love this app. Worth the price, many times over. One qualm is that it would be nice to have the 'coming soon' (when is soon?) more challenging AI's. ATM, only easy levels available. Keep up the development, team!

Great implementation. The AI seems solid enough at the 15s level. Really nice that the AIs can fill in when you don't have a 3rd or 4th player online. Interface buttons are tiny on a standard size phone, but not sure how this could be fixed...
An excellent port
Like the boardgame

Great remake of the board game. But it's unusable for casual games. Timer is locked at 24 hours per move, there is no warning notification if time is running out, and once the player times out they are dropped from the game entirely and cannot be added back in.
Amazing online version of the greatest board game out there.
Good over all, the pretty animations need a disable feature though. It doesn't matter how much time went into making them they get really old after the 78th time, and just slow the game down
Needs the expansion races but otherwise a great port of the board game to an app
Won't launch on Android 8.0 on the pixel XL, please fix this problem.  Update: issues were all addressed with latest update!
Few
Crashes on the new Android 8 update
Won't launch on Android 8.0 Nexus 5x
Great game... very fun the rules seem a little different from the original game.
I have no issues on LG V20, fantastic interface for a very elaborate game. Great work. Digi got back with me right away with questions as well.
Not working for Oreo crashes when my phone starts
Won't launch on Android 8.0 Pixel XL

Buggy. Took several attempts to spend purple power directly for coin. Green check wouldn't show.   Using Fakirs, my first turn wanted to charge 6 purple from second pool to upgrade building (thought i needed 3 coins... had 15). 3 attempts and I was finally charged properly.   Notifications, don't feel like I need to elaborate here.   Please fix your implementation of an otherwise amazing game.
Feels like the board game.
There's a petty impactful bug where I have a notification that it's my turn in an online game, but when I access the list of running games, none of my online games load.
New version, new bug, still not able to play a whole match online. I've recorded a video and I'll send your team :-(
replyContent: Hi, we fixed the free spade bug with version 1.27. Sorry for the bad experience. Hope you give it another try

content: I hate the auto turn hint all the time I know my moves

Terra Mystica is a fantastic board game, but this app just isn't worth it. It's been 4 months and it's still so buggy and user-unfriendly it's practically unusable. Games typically take weeks (sometimes *months*) to finish, which is painful enough. There are loads of small bugs, UI glitches, etc. which would be easy enough to forgive... But then there are bugs which can prevent you from being able to make a move, leading you to timeout and drop from a game that you've spent literally weeks on. Impossibly frustrating... What's even the point?
replyContent: Hi Richard, sorry you had this bad experience. There is a fast game option (Fast ranked queue) where you take 10 minutes per turn). If you play with friends you can play at your own pace. With ranked games we have to make sure it is within reasonable boundaries (not everyone is able to take a turn every hour).

content: Got this to play with friends, what a disappointment. No way to customize turn timers and auto kicking out the player after the timer expires with no option to reinvite completely ruined our games so far. Let us play without a time limit.
replyContent: Hi, if you are playing with friends in a casual game we do not enforce the game timer. If noone taps on the claim victory icon you can game on as long as you want. We will add an additional question so you do not tap on that by accident. Cheers

content: Great implementation of my favorite boardgame. I'm really impressed with the interface implementation of such a complex game!
Having all the rules in this game automated is great for someone who hasn't played it a ton. AI is pretty good and puts up a reasonable challenge.
Great!!!
It's a little bit buggy but i still love it.

The tabletop version of Terra Mystica is awesome. This app? I really wanted to like it, but the bugs make it a waste of time to play, especially if you want to enter the world of online RANKED play. Way WAY overpriced for what it is. For crying out loud, do more betatesting first. Or put it on Kickstarter if you need more funding.
replyContent: Hello Who Conquers, it is a bug. We fixed it in the current version. The hard AI is coming - but it needs time. Please ne patient with us :)

content: Above average game app for a A grade game
Still a tiny bit buggy but wonderful overall
A little buggy. Great gameplay. Perfect 5/7
Great implementation. A few bugs to work out, but overall excellent work.

I have wanted to like this app but I should have just stuck with snellman...buggy since it's release, (not going to bother listing them all here) all of my gaming group who bought the app have abandoned it and game back to snellman.
For newbs, its steep learning curve, very steep

Good first try, but still buggy. For example, I'm often charged workers and coin for using a free action, such as the swarmlings ability to build a free Trading Post. Also, many of the features that say coming soon, such as more difficult AIs and the expansion, have said that for months. I don't think those new features are actually coming.

Probably my favorite board game. Good implementation, but still buggy. Frequently hangs on someone's turn. I suspect most AI takeovers are from a hang. I had to completely uninstall and reinstall to clear the game stuck on my turn. On reinstall, it replayed everyone's last turn, but failed to clear. I exited that particular game and reentered it. It again replayed everyone's turn, but this time allowed me to accept the move and advanced to the next player. Phew. A pain, but at least it cleared. Looking forward to a fix of this chronic problem.
Solid  adaptation of the boardgame
Beautiful adaptation of a brilliant board game.

The design is great, but still many bugs. Last multiplayer game I played I literally lost the ability to submit my move. I even tried to submit other moves just to move the game along, but it keeps saying "error occurred in the game" when I actually submit the move. Restart didn't help.
Abominably slow animation leaves me bored and wanting to do something else before my turn comes back around.
Great game and a good mobile adaptation.  It's hard to pack this much game into a small screen and they did a good job.

Amazing game and app, although the latest update reverted the app to pausing whatever I'm listening to again. Also, the animations are super choppy now when they were pretty smooth before. 5 stars if they fix that incredibly annoying bug.
I always feel like each game should take many more turns to develop complex strategies.   I'm impressed with the quality of all Digidiced games so far
Great asynchronous multiplayer. Looking forward to the expansion update.
True to the board game, hard to see in a small screen.  Worth the money, no ads.  :)
True to boardgame, enjoyed playing this. Randomly nstops working and you have to reinstall everything
One of my favorite games
Aside from odd connection issues, this is a good implementation.
Good implementation of the board game. AI has medium strength

Information in the game is completely inaccessible. No explanation what all the numbers mean. Manual is for the table top game rather than the app. No explanations in the game or tutorial about even what the names of the icons are. No way to go a step back in the tutorials.   A reference button in the game with explanations of everything on screen (like tool tips) would solve lots of this.
Lovely conversation of my favourite board game
One of the very BEST boardgames out there!  Love it.

True to the board game, and an excellent implementation. Have been playing constantly since the app came out. The devs have done a lot of work to rid the game of bugs. However, it is still pretty much inaccessible to people who have not played the board game version, and probably will remain so. The controls are sometime wonky on the phone, cause there is so much that can fit on a screen. AI is a work in progress (deep learning). I hope the UI gets a more modern feel and becomes a bit more responsive at some point.

This is a really good conversion of Terra Mystica.  The interface is very well designed, however I'd suggest going through the tutorial even if you're a veteran.  I can't wait for the more difficult ai and the expansion.  I highly recommend this.
Sometimes buggy controls but good

If you're considering buying this app, maybe give the developers more time to iron out the bugs. Realise this is a very complex game but I feel like they're charging us for a beta app which at $15 a pop, isn't really fair. Anyway, love the boardgame, hopeful an update fixes the problems with the app.
Great game!  They did a good job fitting all the information into the interface but it can still be difficult to remember where things are.  Feels clumsy at times.
Great game, but buggy
I very much like this game but the app isnt great. I have lost the ability to join casual games all together. It is pretty frustrating
Some of the controls are tiny on a phone screen, but an otherwise excellent implementation of a great game.
Very true to the board game. Glitches are constantly being fixed. A great version of the original which is one of my all time favorites.
Would give it 5 stars if it would send me notifications when it's my turn. I timed out and forfeited because I don't receive notifications and I forgot to check the game one day.

An amazing game that I have not had the chance to play until now. Although I didn't find the tutorial as helpful as it could have been, once I read the rules the controls are intuitive and the game plays well. One of my favorite games of all time now.
I impressed how simple this complex game seems. Very clear interface. I look forward to seeing more variety in the AI opponents.
Little glitchy at first but problems have been ironed out for the most part.
The interface is amazing and the graphics are very true to the board game. The Al is very very good and that is only on the easy setting. Worth the money.
Adaptation fidèle du jeu sur plateau  (qui est lui-même un chef d'oeuvre), interface intuitive, énorme rejouabilité. En revanche le tutoriel n'est pas suffisant pour détailler toutes les subtilités.
Great representation of the best strategy board game on the market.
Fantastic app for one of the best games ever created. No issues running on note 4.
Still buggy so I wouldn't take competitive play seriously yet but it's a decent adaptation.

Really good adaptation of a complex board game for mobile. It makes good use of screen real estate, and while there are a lot of tabs to navigate to access all areas of gameplay, it's intuitive after a slight learning curve.   Love that there's asynchronous multiplayer as well as some decent A.I. to practice with.  The one place to improve upon now would be quicker load times, especially when loading active games (or tapping on a notification that it's your turn and jumping right into that game quickly).
Still a lot of bugs

The board game is one of my favorites. This is a great port and didn't take too long to get used to the controls. No setup for faster plays. Great for trying out different strategies. Perfect for long car or plane rides
It's a little bit cumbersome, but overall very well thought-out and fun to play. Thanks
Great game to play with you friends. I love the asynchronous gameplay option. The only downside is that the controls can be a bit confusing at first.

So frustrating sometimes. New to the game, and the tutorials left me a little confused.  Figure I've got it solved, but there's a glitch(?) What are the green numbers under my resource totals & why is there a "0 cup" for magic?  Isn't it supposed to cycle from 3-1 after use?  Where is my missing power?  The tutorial has none of this info in it & I can't find it in the manual.

Great game. Unfortunately there are a lot of bugs. It can be annoying waiting weeks for an update only to see none of your submitted bugs have been fixed. The gameplay is true to the feel of the boardgame.
Good board game. Occassional bug.

Great port of the game.  Biggest problem is the matchmaking and notifications, which occasionally just fail completely. For example, it has a "fast" game feature, but has never once allowed me to actually join a fast game.
Fantastic adaptation of the board game.

Uninstalled. This app pushes badge notifications to my phone (LG G3) even when I block notifications in settings. The number on the icon goes up, but even after I take a turn it never goes down. It also displays on all other Digidice games I had installed, so I had a big orange number displayed on the icons - on home screen and app menu - for Patchwork, Agricola: ACBAS, Inland Port, Terra Mystica, and an unrelated video player. So I started googling solutions and there is just a wealth of information for other systems that don't help me. I spent most of a day troubleshooting this and I'm sick of it so I am just uninstalling this again and not reinstalling because reinstalls don't work.

A reasonable implementation of an excellent game. My major issue with it is that the menu controls are quite flaky - it doesn't make the game unplayable, but things often get stuck or have visual errors.

My favorite table top game comes to life in app  form.  AIs are good already but I am looking forward to Medium and Hard AIs.  It has the small expansion with 4 new town tiles, bonus tile, and round scoring tile.  Very fun and very addicting.
Everything I love about the boardgame
Very buggy. Two ranked online games have ended bc "timing out" even though it never let me take a turn...
This has been my favorite board game since I first tried it. I'm thrilled that there is finally an app for it.

Amazing game, and a great adaptation to mobile - board is readable and all controls can be accessed through sensible interfaces. Only problems are the relatively large number of bugs, which I'm hoping will improve, and very annoying end turn button. Tutorial was excellent and a better introduction to the game than the original rule book.

Long time fan of the board game, and this is a near perfect implementation.  The AI, while slow and likely to be improved, forces itself into a corner less often than you might expect in such a complex game.  One feature I would like: a shortcut on the board to reach 'special' actions without going through the whole interface.
Great implementation
There are bugs and minor UI annoyances, but overall it's a great implementation of the board game.
Great game!!
Mermaid bug fixed. Thank you!
It is pretty impressive, but the AI still needs some work.  Only been out a couple weeks and they say they are working on it.

My favorite boardgame of all time is finally an app! Minor bugs and interface complaints like if you have a special action from a bonus scroll or blessing, you can't look at the before committing your action to it. Also had a few moments when the cultists special cult track feature didn't trigger. But honestly, the complaints are more for the development, and fixable. Buy It!
This is one of the best board game apps I've played. Cross platform works great. There are a few rule issues from what I've read but, overall worth every cent.
There are a few bugs I have hit. I habe played games where my Power was not moved. I have also played games where I got to the top of a cult track and could not move higher, even with a key.
Great implementation of a highly complex game. When quirky rules interpretations and little bugs slip through the cracks, the team works around the clock to get them fixed. Good work guys!

The app seems easy to navigate and does a good job introducing the game. Seems to run pretty well but i havent spent much time with it. I really like what i see. Paying $10 was a no brainer because i know the board game. For those unfamiliar with it you can watch rahdos runthrough of terra mystica on youtube to see how the game is played. He does a great job showing you the board game. This app is like 1/10 of the price of the board game so its a great deal! :)
Fantastic implementation that works for the most part. Little glitches here or there like not providing a round tile bonus keeps me from giving a 5.
Good implementation, but needs a save button and "leave the game" needs a confirmation!
Would love to give this game a higher rating but as all I get is network errors I can't play online

Edit: The below issues have been resolved for me and done quickly.  The app is really very good now that the bugs are mostly gone.    The 15second AI takes multiple minutes to make a decision.  Unacceptable wait time. Playing on a Nexus 5x. Edit: AI wait time fixed, but now offline games are lost when switching between games or leaving the app. An even worse problem.
replyContent: We fixed the SirThinkalot15sec AI to 15 seconds now. It had wrong values. Thanks!

content: I love the table top version, and am blown away there's an app that takes this heavy Euro and makes it accessible on my phone. Well Done.
Awesome game! Great job fixing bugs!
Best board game app I ever played, and for one of the best, if not THE best board games ever
Been looking forward to playing this for a while. Doesn't disappoint.
Ironing out bugs takes time but overall a great digital version of the board game.
A little tight on a cell phone screen, but a very capable port overall. It is difficult to see everything you want to at a glance, but the menu system does work.
Great version of an amazing board game.
Great implementation. A few bugs as it recently game out but for the most part it's real swell
Wish i didnt lose my casual game when i have to swap to a different app. Controls take awhile to get used tl but otherwise great.
Still in its early stages but will be great when it irons out the connectivity issues!
This is a great electronic version of one of my favorite games! The AI seems to work well and I look forward to future updates to smooth out some little details. Worked great for me!
As fun as the real thing.. with all the auto calculation done for you =).

Edit:turn order issue appears to be fixed. But I've played 3 factions and had issues with each one. I got charged full cost for building a swarmling trading post after using their faction power, engineers can't use their bridge building ability more than once per round, and dwarves can't dig and tunnel if using workers to dig. Please fix these issues.
replyContent: We had a bug with the turn order. It should work now as intended. Thank you.

content: Takes a while to learn how to drive it but, oh my! What a game!

Wow this game is buggy and had terrible GUI. Tried for about an hour to get through the tutorials. Kept getting lost or the controls became unresponsive. Nothing a few weeks of QA won't fix. But seriously, get on that. Game itself loss to be amazing, just can't get through tutorial.
My all time favorite game! Still quite a few bugs but it doesn't matter! It's way prettier than snellman!
Fantastic digital conversion of a great board game. Deep gameplay with plenty of meaningful choices to be made each turn. Love it.
Mostly love it.  I wish there were notifications to your phone when it is your turn, and you have to click a lot to make any kind of move.  My favorite board game though, so I'll deal :)
replyContent: Thank you. We fixed the notifications. :)

content: Really well done.
Requires permanent internet connection. Couldn't get through the tutorial on several tries because I lost connectivity to the server. Frustrating
Superb, if a little buggy on release. The 15s AI is unplayable with wait times over 4 minutes. I'm sure it will get addressed.
A few visual glitches with the display of numbers on my old Tab S.  Otherwise, excellent.
This kind of game is always gonna be hard to make a perfect implementation onto digital, but for the most part this app looks like the best it could be.

Excellent adaptation of the original game. I own the base game plus expansion and this digital port is spot on. Can't wait for even further AI updates and am pleased it works on small cell screens (S4)
Yes
Fix the controls. Awful implementation of a brilliant game
replyContent: Hallo Luke. Thank you for your feedback. Can you be a bit more specific what is awful?

content: Great version of a great board game.
Terra mystica on my phone? With controls that actually work great? Amazing! Truly amazing!
I've only played the game 3/4 times before, but I've got to say the AI is really well crafted in this game.  They don't just bend over and lose for you.
I think it's great for launch.  I'm confident it will only get better!  Well done guys!  Really addicted already!
Just like the physical  game will take me a while to beat it
Fantastic implementation of the classic board game!
This is a Terrible Mistake instead of Terra Mystica. Once I place a Dwelling and press "pass", it keep logging me out from google play account when I try the casual game with friends.
replyContent: Hello Rex, we just tried it cross platform and it works just fine (after initial dwelling and passing). Can you send an email with your user name to info@digidiced.com, if the problem persists. Thank you very much.
